Detailed Description

Contains the functions used to make dynamic pages.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef map<MC2String, HttpFunctionNote*> HttpFunctionHandler::FunctionsMap [private]
 

Definition at line 115 of file HttpFunctionHandler.h.

typedef bool( HttpFunctionHandler::htmlFunction)(stringVector *params, int paramc, stringMap *paramsMap, HttpHeader *inHead, HttpHeader *outHead, HttpBody *inBody, HttpBody *outBody, HttpParserThread *myThread, HttpVariableContainer *myVar)
 

Definition of a Html function.

{itemize} The stringVector* is the vector containing the parameters. The int is the acctual number of parameters in the stringVector*. The ParametersMap* contains all the parameters to the page. The first HttpHead* is the Header of the request. The second HttpHead* is the Header of the responce. The first HttpBody* is the body of the request. The secong HttpBody* is the body of the responce. The HttpThread* is the caller of the function. Used to send requests. The HttpVariableContainer contains the variables passed between the functions, while parsing the page. {itemize}
